title: Down By the Creek (Final)
body:
When you look in the mirror at yourself, what do you see?

A weirdo? A normal human being? A success?

What do you see?

I was far away from Tennessee. I hitchhiked all the way up to Colorado in the past few months. I begged for enough money to buy me some warmer clothing. A jean jacket, carpenter jeans, a button up shirt, gloves, duck boots, and a snow cap. Good enough.

If it covered up my decaying skin, I was fine with it.

At first, it started in the center of my chest. Now, it was spread down to my stomach.

The whispers in my head never stopped, and evil thoughts were in my head all the time.

I got to the border of Colorado and found a lake. I went over to the lake and looked at myself in the water.

I didn’t recognize myself.

My face was hollow and thin. I could see my decaying skin sneaking up to my neck.

I was turning into the monster. This time, there was no stopping it.

"It's only a matter of time Scott."

"Shut up!" I yelled.

The voices stopped, but only for a little while.

It had only been a month since I transformed.

I didn’t want to lose my clothing again, that would be bad.

I stepped away from the lake and started to walk down the road. Ahead of me, I saw a forest. I was alone again.

Snow was starting to fall, and my hands were getting numb.

I didn’t feel like hitchhiking again.

Then, a thought hit me.

What if my bank account was still available?

My mom always said that I had a bank account that I could access as an emergency.

I started to get excited.

Maybe my parents left me some money.

After all, they did disown me, right?

I walked on for a mile or two, and that's when I saw a gas station.

There were only three gas pumps, but there was a convenience store inside. My boots crunched on the gravel as I walked inside. Warm air hit me, and that was the best feeling in the world.

There was a bunch of snacks and drinks. I looked to the right of me and saw an ATM.

Bingo!

I went over to the ATM and looked at it. I didn’t have a card to swipe, but that was no problem. Little did the convenience store owner know that I could hack into one of these. My mom showed me how to do it when I was seven.

My mom was always one of those "end of the world" fanatics. Therefore, she always taught me survival skills.

I started to tamper with the pins and the card swipe. There was a special way you had to do it. Almost perfect. After a few minutes of tampering, I finally could access the PIN screens. After a few minutes of hard memory thinking, I remembered my PIN codes. I typed it in and requested $200. Sure enough, it worked.

"Yes!" I shouted.

One of the employees looked at me curiously. He walked over to me slowly.

"Hey, you," He said, "What are you doing?"

I didn’t answer him. After I got the money, I started to walk.

The man followed me.

He followed me out of the store and put a hand on my shoulder.

"Is that your money?" He asked. His grip was like iron, and he was making me angry. My hands were starting to turn black and wispy.

"No." I thought.

"Why don’t you hand me the money and go on your way." The man said.

I clenched my fists and tried to calm myself down.

"Listen, the money is mine." I said calmly.

"Are you sure? I saw you tampering with the ATM." The man said, smartly.

"Just let me go. I don’t want to hurt you." I said, turning around the to face the man.

"If you don’t hand the money over, I'm calling the cops." The man said.

"Fine." I said through gritted teeth. That was the last straw.

I shoved the man back and unleashed a torrent of anger at him. I saw him stagger back in shock. I punched him in the chest so hard that my hand went through.

I was numb to it all.

The man spit up blood and his eyes started to roll back into his head.

I started to transform back.

I pulled my arm out, and it was soaked in blood.

I had lost my clothes again, and I was naked.

I stared at the man on the ground, then, I picked him up by the armpits and dragged him inside the store.

I put him behind the cash register, said a short prayer, then backed away.

Thankfully, there were some clothes in the convenience store.

I went over to the clothing racks. I picked out some underwear, jeans, long sleeve shirt, a jean jacket, and some tennis shoes and socks.

The smell of blood started to fill the air. The smell of pennies.

I looked out the window to make sure no one was looking, or driving by, and then I took a few snacks, and some water, and then headed out.

Therefore, that was my life a now.

A ruthless murderer and a thief.

"Maybe the monster has taken over me." I thought.

I pushed my skin and it sank down. The infection was getting worse.

The snow was falling in big flakes now; covering up the road. I left indentations where I walked.

Then, sharp pains racked my body and I fell to the ground again.

"It's only a matter of time Scott."

The pain continued to torture me, and I was starting to convulse.

"You will succumb to the darkness and this time you will not stop it."

I screamed aloud as my skin started to shift and spread.

"I will never succumb to you." I said, fighting tears.

"Whatever the hell you are, I will never succumb to you."

"Language Scott. Let's not get too violent. Of course, you know who we are."

Then, confusion hit me. Why did the voice say we?

"Why did you say we instead of I?" I asked.

"Because there is more than one of us, and in total, there are 3 of us. Including you."

"Who are the other two you bastards?" I said, fighting the pain.

Then, the voices of Allen and Ralph arose.

"Us." They said.

Then, the pain stopped, and I started to throw up.

Black liquid came out of me like a fountain. I could see an eye, tentacles, and some other things I do not want to describe.

I was just about to die, when the puking ceased.

I laid on my side, gasping for air.

I turned around and saw the monster floating in the air. It was staring at me from a distance.

The voices of Allen and Ralph arose again.

"You didn’t think we were dead, did you?"

That’s when the monster started to split in two.

I could see human forms taking shape. I could see eyes, hair, legs, and arms.

Then, they stood in front of me.

Allen and Ralph.

I stared up at them and they stared back. Their teeth were black and their hair was long too.

They had both grown.

Ralph was even skinnier, and Allen was just about the same.

I scooted back and stood up.

I pointed at them and said, "You both should be dead."

Allen smiled and said, "But we're both standing here Scott, and you know it."

"If you won't succumb to the darkness, then we will make you." Ralph said.

"This can't be happening! You're both dead!" I screamed.

The snow was like a blizzard now.

They both said in unison, "No we're not."

Then, they both transformed and lunged at me.

I took off my clothes and transformed. I collided with them.

They were more powerful, so they tackled me. Allen wrapped his tentacles around my throat and started to choke me. Ralph tried to gouge my eye out, but I fought back. I punched, kicked, and eventually broke free. I slashed my tentacle through the air and cut Allen through the middle. Green blood oozed out. I could hear him shriek.

I ran into the woods, trying to get away, but Ralph caught up to me.

He slammed into me and started to shove his tentacles down my mouth. I gagged and tried to pull them out, but they went in deeper.

Then, I used a force of energy to knock Ralph sideways. He slammed into a nearby tree.

I turned around, just in time to backhand Allen. He fell backwards. I lunged at him and started to choke him, but he was stronger. He threw me off and I slammed into a tree.

A flash of pain went through my side. I looked down and saw a tree branch coming through my skin.

I hopped off the tree and landed in the ground. I tried to get up, but Ralph was on me like a flash. He tried to choke me, but I threw him off.

I got up quickly and saw them both standing there.

They started to morph back into one again.

"How did you guys survive?" I asked.

"We succumbed to the darkness." They said, "And you will too."

They lunged at me, but little did they know that I took out the tree branch that impaled me and hid it behind my back.

I brought it out and it pierced the monster in the eye.

I heard loud screeches and I could see the monster on the ground, convulsing.

The shapes of Allen and Ralph were morphing back and forth.

"You will never win! The darkness always wins!" They shrieked.

"I'm out from the darkness." I said, then, grabbed the branch and yanked it out of the monster. I started to stab the monster with it, and I felt no remorse.

The monster started to disintegrate before my eyes, and I stopped stabbing it. The shapes of Allen and Ralph were still visible, and I knelt beside them.

I could see them crying.

In a quick flash, I felt bad for them, but it went away quickly. They made me into who I was, and there was no forgiving that.

They melted into the snow, turning it black and dark green.

The monster was gone. Destroyed. Demolished, whatever you call it.

I sank to the ground and put my hands in front of my face. Tears leaked down my face.

It was over.

I screamed triumphantly.

I walked over to where I took off my clothes and put them back on. They were damp from the snow, but I couldn’t have cared less.

I went to the side of the road, and after an hour or so, I caught a bus heading back South.

It took me a few months, but I finally got to the Tennessee border.

It's snowing here right now.

I'm at a crossroad. There is four ways to go, but I'm not sure where to go.

I don’t think I belong anywhere anymore.

The monster is still inside me, but it doesn’t bother me. I have control over it now, and there is no stopping it.

I could go back to my house and live there, but I would eventually get caught.

I'm still a fugitive, so there is no stopping for me.

I will forever live my life as a rambling man.

It’s sad to think of it, but maybe I'll find love, who knows right?

The snow is still falling.

I'm writing this as I stand in the middle of the crossroad. For just a moment, I could have sworn I heard music from a distance. Maybe there is a car coming my way.

Will I ever become normal again?

Will I ever live a normal life?

The chances are low, but who knows, I may get lucky.

But for now, only time will tell...

only time will tell.
author: Dan100903
